Patch Set 24:

As per hwsv implementation of sbe dump, not sure if it is different for openbmc
1) clock on and clock off should not go in parallel
2) dump needs to be collected for all the procs present in the system
3) parallelization should be done at node level, i.e we use thread pool and seperate thread per node
4) dump collection for all the procs should go in serial in a node.

hwsv was using thread pool for parallelization we might need to check if such a thing is required in openbmc


For now
1) if clock on and off need to go in serial we can remove fork and push the changes
2) at later stages we can add other features.

this my observation based on hwsv it may or might not be applicable to openbmc so make your own decision

@ojayanth @dhruv

Patch Set 24:

> Patch Set 24:
> 
> As per hwsv implementation of sbe dump, not sure if it is different for openbmc
> 1) clock on and clock off should not go in parallel
> 2) dump needs to be collected for all the procs present in the system
> 3) parallelization should be done at node level, i.e we use thread pool and seperate thread per node
> 4) dump collection for all the procs should go in serial in a node.
> 
> hwsv was using thread pool for parallelization we might need to check if such a thing is required in openbmc
> 
> 
> For now
> 1) if clock on and off need to go in serial we can remove fork and push the changes
> 2) at later stages we can add other features.
> 
> this my observation based on hwsv it may or might not be applicable to openbmc so make your own decision
> 
> @ojayanth @dhruv

- Since the clock is in serial the dbus call has to wait for longest clock on call, so still keeping the fork

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/66994/ : SUCCESS
please rephrase. Are you saying phosphor dump manager creates dump based on request from ? please elaborate the scope of this function her. it will help reviewers.
Please innclude the  temporary path info
Since this new code in openpower-debug-colletector include unit tests.
There is no unit test infrastructure for this repo, need to enable that first.

There is no testable code in this repository. Kind of place holder repo to support Host debug.
Since this is new function adding here, right time to enable this and design new functions to support unit testing framework.

Is this check is happening prior to dump collection? or aftre packaging? incase no space  available to package this dump why , need to initiate dump collection? 
Design should be return error for create request. incase insufficient space.
Any hardware limitation just a policy here?
another const missing i.e const struct pdbg_target* proc
this isMasterProc could throw exception and if it is thrown to the caller through D-Bus it might core dump, do veriy this path
only the child will fail, handled  the crash
this error message does not tally with the check above,  why we are not throwing exception here? is it expected behavior?
BMC has  no way to know whether it can collect DUMP from slave or not, so if there is a failure from slave just skip it

Couple points need to consider here:
- Slave SBE chip-op is going to fail, if some one issues the chip prior to SBE init, Befire activate slave SBE's.
- Slave processor Hardware data collection fails, incase slvae processor clocks not initlized . - I think as part of of hostboot dump , Master processor memory + hw data and for slave only memory data. 

Is this current direction is agreed fail handling approch with Hostboot/sbe team?
Asked to SBE team but not hostboot, I can check but do we have reliable way whether the data needs to be collected from slave?

CFAM register 2809 , used to check SBE status , Also Hostboot also maintains the Istep status in the oe of the CFAM register. 
Add API to check SBE state in pdbg , and application start using this helper function to check sbe state. Extend the same logic for hostboot state check if required . or use hostboot ipl progress status for the same.
this being D-bus method throwing this error might core dump, do test this path
BMC has  no way to know whether it can collect DUMP from slave or not, so if there is a failure from slave just skip it
Message should be rephrased , say, SBE is not ready or failed to collect dump data. instead of making generic statemnet here.  sam as above.
collection will reach here only if the SBE is ready now, so throwing error if the chip-op failed, but skipping if the data length is 0 from a slave and that is expected
Handle  filesystem_errors, like failed to create directory.
Hostboot dump request is required only for master processor ? any specific reason here to iterate on all processors?
Should be using HWAS state  of parent processor here , instead of pdbg level functional state.
It depends on the state of IPL, so will attempt to collect from all processors, and skip the failure if the slave collection is failed.

Can you document the dump collection flow or point some documntaion related to this here, this will help reviewers.?
Question : incase of failure here ,noticed below code , skipping dump colleftion. if you are using that strategy why you are continuing to collect dump for other clock states and processor
if there is a failure in collection from master, there will be an exception to stop collection.
what if dump collection passed and failed for few targets do we still consider fail
no the exception will be thrown only if the chip-op failed for slaves, if no data recieved also considered as pass
// Host dumps are governed by dump policy. Where is the dump policy and manufacturing policy specific check is included?
That handling will be in phosphor debug collector, an exception will be returned once the dump policy is enabled.
where is the code associated  max number/ allowed dump size policy check  ? What is the maximum allowed size or numbers for hostboot dump.?
That handling will be in phosphor debug collector, an exception will be thrown if the quota exceeded.
Incase of MPIPL, Host dump collections is allowed?
capture e.what() in the traces as it has the actual error info
can't we throw the same exception like throw e;

Openpower- debug-collectror repository used to for host debug function support repository. Please keep the dump specific functions dump specific p[ath, /dump/hostboot. this will help to support various dumps. or  are you planing to use openpower::dump::manager as genric class to support all types of hostboot dumps infuture?
This can support any dumps collected from SBE, I will move this to ./dump folder
This value is based chip-op spec? please move this definition as part of chip-op specific header file , that will help track exeternal spc specific constatndt at common place.
If these constants are not used in .H file and used only in .C file then declare them in .C file, that way we do not expose to other files.
These are accepted as unit8_t so cant convert to enum
why this code is in openpower-debug-collector, we are implementing dump interface
bool isMasterProc(const struct pdbg_target* proc) const;
cant make const since internal callers are not using const
are u expecting this to be modified? then make it in/out, or else make it const
Do not end the subject line with a period
Please include the design direction used for collection, is it for all SBE's or any sbe state based collection etc.
If the collection failed on any of the slaves, will continue with available dumps, if there are other errors like writing to file etc an internal error will be logged to collect the BMC dump.
internal error creates BMC dump . please make sure this is not causing any side effect, like requetsing dump during another dump request . Better avoid internal errors in the dump code.
Will use internal errors if there is a BMC internal issue
AC_CHECK_LIB (library, function.. ) . please add function you want to specifically you are looking here.
There is already HWP to check SBE state , refer https://github.ibm.com/phal/ipl/blob/master/libipl/p10/common.C#L114.
There are issues when calling the HWP directly, will look at whether the IPL function to check whether sbe booted can be used
better to move this function libpdbg. This will be commonly used by other app also.

Recomenation is to libdt_api based interfaces to avoid hard coding attriubute size and types.
refer https://github.ibm.com/phal/pdata/pull/43/commits/de3545da0fb71c32d8d6f566c97586f3532c7dff.  serch ### libdt-api
What is the max size of this buffer , who is in charge of allocating and freeing this buffer. ?
this function throwning exception. based on the current design direction used here , should be caoturing the exception and skip the dump collection specific to processor.
will log an internal error to capture the BMC dump in this exception
please see the commit message related to internal failure error usage.
Internal errors needs to logged when there are internal inconstancy in the BMC
Need to address patch set 7 comments.
this is specific to master processor right? better update the log message accordingly.
This is required for slave processor also , like contradicting design direction used earlier.Like ignore slave processor.
the design is to continue only in the case of SBE collection error.
Required BMC dump here to debug this failure?
Yes this is an internal BMC issue
please see the comments in commit message related to this.
filesystem malfunctioning is an internal error
why this check required , HWAS_STATE update is based on pdbg target state. In summary you should probe target .
if the target is not enabled skip that target.
HWAS_STATE is based on PDBG_TARGET_ENABLED status. IPL time the HWAS_STATE attribute would be updated with correct status in the dev tree. not required , only probe is fine.
The comment is not clear, should keep the HWAS state checking or this probe?
refer the commnets related attribute read.
do you want to check present or functional here? In the slave processor error path Hostboot triggerd dumpafter decconfigure is valid case ?
In no case a processor will get deconfigured after a poweron, so this is safe

Noticed , incase slave processor helper function failure case also throwing execption. i think the design direction iused is to continue dump collection for slave processor failure. please reveist the error handling code and follow the same direction, and incase you want to deviate please add comments. this will help reveiers to understand the flow.
Exceptions wont be thrown in the case of slave SBE collection failure, but only if there are other errors like file handling, will handle file errors here and report an internal failure.
Removed as we should use libipl function
Collect hostboot dump from each SBE ?
ignored means no informational log associate to failure?
Yes until there is a way to check whether slave is booted.
Here Dump size is in the range for 80MB ( for master processor). Need test summary related performance aspect. like no side effect related to power-off path
you can add the details of the testing based on the current dump size.
better to align this portion, like other places in the code.
it is better to follow the directory structure  /dumpextensions/<dump type> . this will help future features addition cleanly.
There wont be separate files per types
Use tab consistently.  Not sure my browser issue or not some line tab is missing.
Move this definition in common place. Multiple function using the same.
Move this definition in common place. Multiple function using the same.
Please add comment- dump file name format

Max size of data is in the range 80mb . pdbg maintain any timeout? 
Or where is the data transfer ( full size) timeout handles.
That should be handled in the lower levels

'dump-collection' collection by default is set to 'disabled' in meson_options.txt, and this will not build dump related binaries unless this option is enabled during build. What is the reason to keep this option disabled by default?
